meanings.definition: People who talk quickly and continuously, often in a trivial or unimportant way.
meanings.sent1: The chatterers in the classroom never seemed to run out of things to say.
meanings.sent2: The park was filled with chatterers discussing the weather and their pets.
meanings.sent3: The chatterers at the party made the room buzz with their constant chatter.
meanings.sent4: The chatterers in the office were like busy bees, always buzzing around.
meanings.sent5: The chatterers in the library were as loud as a flock of birds.

meanings.definition: A group of individuals who engage in noisy and meaningless conversation.
meanings.sent1: The chatterers in the cafeteria could be heard from across the room.
meanings.sent2: The street corner was crowded with chatterers sharing gossip and jokes.
meanings.sent3: The chatterers in the waiting room made the time pass quickly with their stories.
meanings.sent4: The chatterers in the park were like a symphony of voices, all blending together.
meanings.sent5: The chatterers in the market were as lively as a group of chirping crickets.
